description: From Middle English malicious, from Old French malicios, from Latin malitiōsus, from malitia (“malice”), from malus (“bad”). Displaced native Old English yfelwillende.

adjectives.description: malicious (comparative more malicious, superlative most malicious)

entries.meaning: Intending to do harm; characterized by spite and malice.
examples: He was sent off for a malicious tackle on Jones.
